definition: camel/white horse with a black mane (archaic)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
the straw that broke the camel’s back (idiom)/the final straw
pinyin: ya1 si3 luo4 tuo5 de5 zui4 hou4 yi1 gen1 dao4 cao3
containing_words.word: 压死骆驼的最后一根稻草

definition: xylitol (Cantonese)/see also 木糖醇[mu4 tang2 chun2]
abbr. for Wang Bo 王勃[Wang2 Bo2], Yang Jiong 楊炯|杨炯[Yang2 Jiong3], Lu Zhaolin 盧照鄰|卢照邻[Lu2 Zhao4 lin2], and Luo Binwang 駱賓王|骆宾王[Luo4 Bin1 wang2], the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang

lit. even a scrawny camel is bigger than a horse (idiom)/fig. even after suffering a loss, a rich person is still better off than ordinary people/a cultured person may come down in the world, but he is still superior to the common people
pinyin: shou4 si3 de5 luo4 tuo5 bi3 ma3 da4

definition: Luo Binwang (640-684), one of Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
Camel Xiangzi, novel by Lao She 老舍

sentences.english: Locke's (Mandarin) Chinese family name is Luo.
sentences.chinese: 如果按照普通话，骆家辉的中国姓为骆。

sentences.english: Buildings in order to comfort LuoTianMing, her about doing had tea together.
sentences.chinese: 顾阡陌为了安慰骆天明，她约小春父子俩一起喝茶。

definition: surname Xue/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
surname Di/variant of 狄[Di2], generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
